template.description: A set of workflows to query a source and determine if record creation or updates are required.
template.name: Audit-Query-and-Update-20180122

processGroups.comments: Based on an initial query from SQS, retireve records froma source and determine if update or creation of records is needed at a destination.

Start with a Replication Record query string in SQS: DPN-NiFi-Repl-Flow Set &page_size=1 to trap a single record in the response.
Repl records that are unfulfilled and not cancelled are flagged in the log

config.comments:
A replication may have the following states:
"store_requested" "stored" "cancelled" Description False False False Initial state - request created but not serviced True False False Request Acknowledged True False True Request Denied - a reason must be added in "cancel_reason", "cancel_reason_detail" True True False Bag retrieved, validated and stored in local environment A checksum must be added to complete the transaction

entry.key: Max Data to Post per Second

value.name: Max Data to Post per Second

entry.key: Attributes to Send as HTTP Headers (Regex)

value.name: Attributes to Send as HTTP Headers (Regex)

Attributes to Send as HTTP Headers (Regex)

processGroups.name: DPN-Replication-Audit

processGroups.comments:
Start with a Bag Record query string in SQS: DPN-NiFi-Flow Set &page_size=1 to trap a single record in the response.
Bag records deviating from number of replications policy are written to the log

entry.key: Max Data to Post per Second
Attributes to Send as HTTP Headers (Regex)

processGroups.name: DPN-Ingest-Bags-Audit

processGroups.comments:
Start with a query string in SQS: DPN-NiFi-Flow Set &page_size=1 to trap a single record in the response.
Log records that violate replication policy Update Bag records "replicating_nodes" with completed replications

config.comments: Destination host and token - assumed to the the same as Source host
Destination host and token - assumed to be the same as Source host, since a direct comparison is made for update
